results.title: The World of the unborn. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description: Part 1 of the program explains what happens at the point of conception when the egg and sperm are formed and united. A discussion about DNA and chromosones is also included as well as an examination of the development and changes which occur during puberty. Part 2 examines the development of the fertilised egg as it implants itself in the wall of the uterus and the progression of the embryo to foetus until birth. Also featured are the physiological changes which occur during pregnancy. The photography and computer animation used in the program are outstanding.

results.title: The World of the molecule
results.brief_description: Nobel Prize winner Professor Hermann Staudinger speaks about macro molecules. In the age of mass consumption no branch of the chemical industry has experienced a boom such as that if the production of plastic.

results.title: The World of the Koala
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
Koalas manage to survive exclusively on a diet of eucalyptus leaves, and in this program we go twenty metres up into the trees to observe the endearing behaviour of mother koalas and their young. The program also observes the habitat and wildlife surrounding the koala, as well as threats to its survival such as bushfires and tree felling.

results.title: The World of the future
results.creator_credit: Hobel-Leiterman Productions, Philip S. Hobel, Douglas Leiterman and Peter Thurling
results.brief_description: Looks at the changing lifestyles and subcultures of the future, the changing environment and the effect on people, their values and their ability to cope. Includes footage from George Lucas’ first science fiction feature “THX-1138”.

results.title: The World of the artist: three paintings by Hieronymus Bosch
results.creator_credit: J.H. Lenauer, Mavis Lyons, George Jacobson and Filmmakers
results.brief_description: “The Adoration of the Kings”, “The Mocking of the Christ” and “Ecce Homo” are the three paintings of the Flemish artist Bosch simply and carefully analysed. Excellent color and absence of dramatisation distinguish this short art film. The three paintings are in the Johnson Collection in the Philadelphia Museum of Art.

results.title: The World of semi conductors
results.creator_credit: A E I and Michael Oitom
results.brief_description: Describes the electrical properties of semiconductor materials, the effects of adding various controlled impurities, and the way in which semiconductors can be used for rectification or as amplifiers. Examples of both applications are shown, ranging from the minute transistorised transmitter in a radio pill for medical research to the banks of semiconductor rectifiers on heavy duty electric railway locomotives. Sketches the manufacturing process involved and examines the possibility of using semiconductors for power generation, central heating and refrigeration.

results.title: The World of PVC
results.creator_credit: John G. Berry, British Geo Ltd, Dormar Productions and Bob Kellett
results.brief_description: PVC is the most versatile plastic of all and thiis film is about the process and manufacture of PVC. Tells about its low maintenance and long-lasting protective function. Some if its uses include: 33 1/3 records, raincoats, floor coverings, wallets and briefcases, covers for barges, car and haystacks, and pipes for building industry. PVC is made from oil and coal.

results.title: The World of Peter Rabbit and friends
results.creator_credit: John Coates, Frederick Warne and Company and TVC London
results.brief_description: The delightful drawings and stories of Beatrix Potter are stunningly recreated in this excellent series. From the mischievious Peter Rabbit and his near fatal encounter with Mr. McGregor, to Jemima Puddle-duck and her naive trust in the Fox, these stories will entertain and stimulate young minds.
